instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> really low output on headphones
threads.message:
Just replaced SMC and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and the MacBook now works fine except the audio output on headphones is really low.
Anyone seen this before?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> really low output on headphones
threads.message: Headphone comes straight out of the codec <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>. Measure on diode mode both left and right outputs and compare to good one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> really low output on headphones
threads.message: There where a couple of ripped caps above <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>, replaced <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and added the caps. All good now, thank you.
